Description: Ostracon, large section of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and pinkish in section, both the interior and exterior are covered with a light-brown deposit, the exterior bears the remains of one line of incised Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394327) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394327)
